trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a XAML serialization attempt is made on a <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaValue`1"></xref> or <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaReference`1"></xref>.
<xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaValue%601> and <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaReference%601> are used for lambda expressions specified in code and are not XAML serializable.

If an attempt is made to serialize a workflow that contains a <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaValue%601> or <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaReference%601>, a <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaSerializationException> is thrown.

If the containing workflow requires XAML serialization, use <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicValue%601> or <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Activities.VisualBasicReference%601>, or use <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.ExpressionServices> to convert the <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaValue%601> or <xref:System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaReference%601> to a serializable format.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaSerializationException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaSerializationException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaSerializationException"></xref> class with serialized data.
The serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Expressions.LambdaSerializationException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.
